goals.question: What is the distribution of income across different age groups?
goals.visualization: Box plot of income by age group
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of income across different age groups and identify any outliers or trends.

goals.question: What is the relationship between education level and income?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of income by education level
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation between education level and income, and whether higher education leads to higher income.

goals.question: What is the average income by gender?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of average income by gender
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand any gender pay gap and identify any disparities in income between males and females.

goals.question: What is the distribution of income by occupation?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of income across different occupations and identify any high or low paying jobs.

goals.question: What is the trend of income over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of income over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand any changes in income over time and identify any trends or patterns.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    age_groups = data.groupby('age_group')['income']
    plt.boxplot([group for _, group in age_groups], labels=age_groups.groups.keys())
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title("What is the distribution of income across different age groups?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['education_level'], data['income'])
    plt.xlabel('Education Level')
    plt.ylabel('Income')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between education level and income?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    avg_income_by_gender = data.groupby('gender')['income'].mean()
    avg_income_by_gender.plot(kind='bar', rot=0)
    plt.title("What is the average income by gender?", wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel("Gender")
    plt.ylabel("Average Income")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    data['occupation'].value_counts().plot(kind='bar')
    plt.xlabel('Occupation')
    plt.ylabel('Income')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of income by occupation?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data = data.sort_values(by='date')
    
    plt.plot(data['date'], data['income'])
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    plt.title("What is the trend of income over time?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
